description:
From the continuing reclamation of the ruins of the planet Solo, mysterious mechas are excavated. But suddenly, an alien called Buff Clan attacks seeking the limitless energy “Ide.” The earthlings are backed into a corner, when the three mechas piloted by the earth boy Yuki Cosmo and others fuse together. Becoming the giant robot Ideon, they use their incredible power to fight back against Buff Clan.

(Source: Sunrise)

tags.name: Space Opera
tags.description: Centers around space warfare, advanced technology, chivalric romance and adventure.

tags.name: War
tags.description: Partly or completely set during wartime.

tags.name: Cosmic Horror
tags.description: A type of horror that emphasizes human insignificance in the grand scope of cosmic reality; fearing the unknown and being powerless to fight it.

tags.name: Fugitive
tags.description: Prominently features a character evading capture by an individual or organization.

tags.name: Military
tags.description: Centered around the life and activities of military personnel.

tags.name: Super Robot
tags.description: Prominently features large robots often piloted by hot-blooded protagonists.

tags.name: Tragedy
tags.description: Centers around tragic events and unhappy endings.

tags.name: Ensemble Cast
tags.description: Features a large cast of characters with (almost) equal screen time and importance to the plot.

tags.name: Aliens
tags.description: Prominently features extraterrestrial lifeforms.

tags.name: Travel
tags.description: Centers around character(s) moving between places a significant distance apart.

tags.name: Philosophy
tags.description: Relating or devoted to the study of the fundamental nature of knowledge, reality, and existence.

tags.name: Space
tags.description: Partly or completely set in outer space.

tags.name: Lost Civilization
tags.description: Featuring a civilization with few ruins or records that exist in present day knowledge.

tags.name: Guns
tags.description: Prominently features the use of guns in combat.

tags.name: Heterosexual
tags.description: Prominently features a romance between a man and a woman, not inherently sexual.

tags.name: Estranged Family
tags.description: At least one family member of the MC intentionally distances themselves or a family distances themselves from a person related to the MC.

tags.name: Real Robot
tags.description: Prominently features mechanical designs loosely influenced by real-world robotics.

tags.name: Samurai
tags.description: Prominently features warriors of medieval Japanese nobility bound by a code of honor.

tags.name: Revenge
tags.description: Prominently features a character who aims to exact punishment in a resentful or vindictive manner.

tags.name: Swordplay
tags.description: Prominently features the use of swords in combat.

tags.name: Dinosaurs
tags.description: Prominently features Dinosaurs, prehistoric reptiles that went extinct millions of years ago.

tags.name: Nudity
tags.description: Features a character wearing no clothing or exposing intimate body parts.

name.native: フォルモッサ・シェリル

node.description:
[Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/富野由悠季) | [Wiki (en)](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Yoshiyuki_Tomino)

Yoshiyuki Tomino is an anime creator best known for creating the Gundam anime franchise.

Began his career in 1963 with [Osamu Tezuka](https://anilist.co/staff/96938/)'s company, [Mushi Production](https://anilist.co/studio/68/), scripting and directing episodes of the first Japanese anime television series, [Astro Boy](https://anilist.co/anime/2747/). He later became one of the most important members of the anime studio [Sunrise](https://anilist.co/studio/14/), going on to direct numerous anime through the '70s, '80s and '90s. He is perhaps best known for his transformation of the "Super Robot" mecha anime genre into the "Real Robot" genre with 1979's [Mobile Suit Gundam](https://anilist.co/anime/80/), the first in the Gundam franchise.

Known for using numerous pseudonyms.

(Source: Wikipedia)

[Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/富野由悠季) | [Wiki (en)](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Yoshiyuki_Tomino)

Yoshiyuki Tomino is an anime creator best known for creating the Gundam anime franchise.

Began his career in 1963 with [Osamu Tezuka](https://anilist.co/staff/96938/)'s company, [Mushi Production](https://anilist.co/studio/68/), scripting and directing episodes of the first Japanese anime television series, [Astro Boy](https://anilist.co/anime/2747/). He later became one of the most important members of the anime studio [Sunrise](https://anilist.co/studio/14/), going on to direct numerous anime through the '70s, '80s and '90s. He is perhaps best known for his transformation of the "Super Robot" mecha anime genre into the "Real Robot" genre with 1979's [Mobile Suit Gundam](https://anilist.co/anime/80/), the first in the Gundam franchise.

Known for using numerous pseudonyms.

(Source: Wikipedia)

[Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/%E3%81%99%E3%81%8E%E3%82%84%E3%81%BE%E3%81%93%E3%81%86%E3%81%84%E3%81%A1) | [Wiki (en)](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Koichi_Sugiyama)

Kouichi Sugiyama is a Japanese composer, conductor, and orchestrator.

Sugiyama is known for composing the music for the Dragon Quest video game series, along with several other games, anime, film, and television shows. Classically trained, Sugiyama is considered a major inspiration for other Japanese game music composers. He is also a council member of the Japanese Society for Rights of Authors, Composers, and Publishers (JASRAC), board member of the Japan Institute for National Fundamentals, and honorary chairman of the Japanese Backgammon Society. In 2020, he was named a Person of Cultural Merit by the Japanese government.

(Source: Wikipedia)

[Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/谷口守泰)

A veteran animator with a career spanning nearly 60 years.

__Graduated:__ Tokyo Zokei University

Takizawa Toshifumi was a Japanese director, episode director and storyboard artist.

After he graduated Tokyo Zokei University, he got to work at Tokyo Animation Film, where he worked as part of a photography team. In later years he started working for Shin-Ei Douga, where he was a production assistant. After he started working at Nippon Sunrise, he became a director, giving his debut in 1985 with the Dirty Pair TV series. He continued working as a director afterwards, but as a freelancer instead.

He was a line director on the Ideon Be Invoked film, he was also involved in the Votoms series and has directed Gonzo's TV adaption of Kurosawa's epic Samurai 7 film, which he did in 2004.

Toshifumi passed away on June 22, 2015 from esophageal cancer. He was 61 years old when he died, and up until that point he would still be doing his ordinary activities like driving his car and walking his dog.

[Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/浦上靖夫)

Founder of [Audio Planning U](https://anilist.co/studio/6561/), and the father of [Keiko](https://anilist.co/staff/162367/) and [Yasuyuki Urakami](https://anilist.co/staff/144509/).

In 2016, he received an Honorary Achievement Award for his role as a sound director in [Detective Conan](https://anilist.co/anime/235/).

[Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/湖川友謙)

Most known for his work in the '80s with [Sunrise](https://anilist.co/studio/14/).

Often goes by one of his many pen-names.

[Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/湖川友謙)

Most known for his work in the '80s with [Sunrise](https://anilist.co/studio/14/).

Often goes by one of his many pen-names.

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/8tabe5817) | [Wiki (en)](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Katsuyoshi_Yatabe) | [Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/谷田部勝義)

Yatabe Katsuyoshi is a Japanese screenwriter and director.     

After graduating he joined the Department of Arts at Nihon Daigaku in 1975. In 1978 he joined Ad Cosmo but felt that as subcontractor there would be no real productions done and thus went on to join Sunrise in 1979. There he learned under [Tomino Yoshiyuki](https://anilist.co/staff/97337) and [Takahashi Ryousuke](https://anilist.co/staff/100957) before becoming freelancer.
_Note: Not to be confused with the [composite artist](https://anilist.co/staff/154403/)._

[Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/富野由悠季) | [Wiki (en)](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Yoshiyuki_Tomino)

Yoshiyuki Tomino is an anime creator best known for creating the Gundam anime franchise.

Began his career in 1963 with [Osamu Tezuka](https://anilist.co/staff/96938/)'s company, [Mushi Production](https://anilist.co/studio/68/), scripting and directing episodes of the first Japanese anime television series, [Astro Boy](https://anilist.co/anime/2747/). He later became one of the most important members of the anime studio [Sunrise](https://anilist.co/studio/14/), going on to direct numerous anime through the '70s, '80s and '90s. He is perhaps best known for his transformation of the "Super Robot" mecha anime genre into the "Real Robot" genre with 1979's [Mobile Suit Gundam](https://anilist.co/anime/80/), the first in the Gundam franchise.

Known for using numerous pseudonyms.

(Source: Wikipedia)
